Sebenarnya Rasul saw adalah manusia biasa. Perbedaan dengan orang biasa hanyalah terletak pada wahyu yang diterimanya dan tugas yang dibebankan kepada beliau, yakni memberikan bimbingan dan pengajaran yang telah digariskan Allah untuk manusia. Nabi hanyalah memberi peringatan dan membawa berita gembira kepada orang yang beriman.
text.189:
Dalam ayat ini Allah menjelaskan bahwa manusia itu diciptakan dari jenis yang satu, dan dari jenis yang satu itu diciptakan pasangannya, maka hiduplah mereka berpasangan pria-wanita (suami-isteri) dan tenteramlah dia dengan isterinya itu. Hidup berpasangan suami-isteri merupakan tuntutan kodrati manusia rohaniyah dan jasmaniah. Bila seseorang telah mencapai usia dewasa, timbullah keinginan untuk hidup berpasangan sebagai suami-isteri, dan dia akan mengalami keguncangan batin apabila keinginan itu tidak tercapai. Sebab dalam berpasangan suami-isteri itulah terwujud ketenteraman. Ketenteraman tidak akan terwujud dalam diri manusia diluar hidup berpasangan suami-isteri. Maka tujuan kehadiran seorang isteri pada seorang laki-laki di dalam agama Islam ialah menciptakan hidup berpasangan itu sendiri. Islam mensyariatkan manusia agar mereka hidup berpasangan suami-isteri, karena dalam situasi hidup demikian itu manusia menemukan ketenteraman dan kebahagian rohaniyah dan jasmaniah.

Bila kedua suami-isteri itu berkumpul, mulailah isterinya mengandung benih. Saat permulaan dari pertumbuhan benih itu terasa ringan. Pertama-tama terhentinya haid dan selanjutnya benih itu terus berproses, perlahan-lahan. Maka ketika kandungannya mulai berat, ibu-bapak memanjatkan doa kepada Allah agar keduanya dianugerahi anak yang saleh, sempurna jasmani, berbudi luhur, cakap melaksanakan tugas kewajiban sebagai manusia. Kedua, isteri itu berjanji akan mewajibkan atas dirinya sendiri untuk bersyukur kepada Allah karena menerima nikmat itu dengan perkataan, perbuatan dan keyakinan.
text.190: Allah memperkenankan doa kedua suami-isteri itu dengan menganugerahkan anak yang saleh kepada keduanya. Tetapi kemudian mereka tidaklah bersyukur kepada Allah atas nikmat itu, bahkan mereka menisbahkan anak yang saleh itu kepada berhala-berhala dengan mengatakan bahwa anak itu hamba dari patung-patung, atau mereka hubungkan anak itu kepada binatang-binatang atau kepada alam. Mereka tidak mengatakan anak itu sebagai anugerah Allah. Oleh karena itu mereka tidak bersyukur kepada Allah. Maha Suci Allah dari apa yang mereka sekutukan.
text.191:
Kemudian Allah dalam ayat ini mencela keras sikap, pikiran dan tingkah laku orang-orang yang menyembah berhala yang tidak dapat menciptakan sesuatu pun walaupun hanya benda-benda yang rendah nilainya, karena berhala-berhala itu sendiri dibikin oleh tangan manusia. Tidaklah wajar bagi orang-orang yang punya pikiran menjadikan berhala itu sebagai sembahan, baik dia dipandang sebagai sekutu Allah dalam menerima ibadah ataupun sebagai perantara antara manusia dengan Allah. Sebab segala pujian atau sembahan kepada selain Allah sedikitpun tidak ada faedahnya. Firman Allah swt:

Wahai manusia! Telah dibuat suatu perumpamaan. Maka dengarkanlah! Sesungguhnya segala yang kamu seru selain Allah tidak dapat menciptakan seekor lalat pun, walaupun mereka bersatu untuk menciptakannya. Dan jika lalat itu merampas sesuatu dari mereka. Mereka tidak dapat merebut kembali dari lalat itu. Sama lemahnya yang menyembah dan yang disembah. (al-Hajj/22: 73)
text.192: Ayat ini seperti ayat-ayat yang lalu menggambarkan penyembah-penyembah berhala pada umumnya, termasuk kemusyrikan Arab Mekah. Allah menjelaskan bahwa sembahan-sembahan kaum musyrikin itu tidak punya kesanggupan apa-apa, baik dalam memberi pertolongan terhadap diri mereka sendiri, ketika terjadi serangan dari musuh kepada penyembah-penyembah itu, ataupun mereka ditimpa oleh malapetaka, patung-patung itu tidak dapat memberikan pertolongan. Bahkan bila ada seseorang mengotori patung-patung itu atau mencuri perhiasannya, niscaya patung itu tidak dapat membela dirinya sendiri. Demikianlah patung-patung itu hanya disembah dan dibela, tetapi menyembah itu tak dapat imbalan apa-apa dari patung itu.
text.193:
Allah swt menyatakan dalam ayat ini kepada kaum musyrikin bahwa jika mereka memohon kepada berhala-berhala itu agar memberi petunjuk kepada mereka sebagaimana mereka memohon kepada Allah agar memberi kebaikan, tentulah berhala-berhala itu tidak dapat memberi petunjuk ke jalan yang menuju cita-cita mereka atau ke jalan yang menuju keselamatan mereka dari kesulitan dan kesukaran yang menimpa mereka. Berhala-berhala itu tidak dapat mengikuti keinginan mereka, dan tidak pula memperkenankan permohonan mereka. Keadaannya sama saja apakah penyembah-penyembah berhala itu memohon sesuatu kepada berhala itu ataukah mereka tidak minta apa-apa. Berhala itu tidak akan paham permohonan mereka, tidak mendengar dan tidak pula memikirkan apa yang diucapkan kepada mereka.

Patutkah sesuatu yang memiliki sifat-sifat di atas itu disembah. Seharusnya yang disembah itu ialah Allah Yang memberi manfaat kepada yang menyembah-Nya. Yang memberi hukuman kepada yang berbuat maksiat kepada-Nya. Yang menghancurkan musuh-musuh-Nya. Yang memberikan petunjuk kepada yang taat kepada-Nya, dan mendengarkan doa-doa orang-orang yang berdoa kepada-Nya.
text.194:
Dalam ayat ini ditandaskan bahwa sesembahan selain Allah yang menjadi tujuan doa kaum musyrikin itu sebenarnya makhluk seperti mereka. Doa adalah pengharapan dan permintaan dari orang yang mengucapkan kepada siapa saja yang dipandangnya mempunyai kekuatan yang lebih besar dari dia untuk memenuhi pengharapan, baik untuk mendapatkan kemanfaatan ataupun untuk menolak kesusahan dan kerugian. Mengapa mereka memanjatkan doa kepada berhala-berhala yang sebenarnya adalah makhluk Allah seperti mereka, yang tunduk kepada kudrat dan iradat Allah swt. Sangat tidak logis jika mereka memohon kepada berhala-berhala itu sesuatu yang mereka sendiri, dan juga berhala-berhala itu tidak dapat mencapainya. Seharusnya mereka memanjatkan doa kepada Allah Pencipta dan Pengatur segala sebab dan akibat dalam alam ini. Segala benda mati dan benda hidup di dalam alam ini semua tunduk kepada Sunnah-Nya.

Akan tetapi jika kaum musyrik itu meyakini bahwa kepercayaan mereka benar yaitu berhala itu mampu memberi kemanfaatan ataupun menolak kemudaratan yang tidak sanggup dikerjakan oleh manusia, biarlah mereka berdoa kepada berhala itu kalau doa itu memang dapat dikabulkan oleh berhala itu. Sungguh amat sesat pikiran orang-orang yang memandang bahwa benda mati itu punya daya dan kekuatan seperti Tuhan Pencipta-Nya.
text.195:
Dalam ayat ini Allah memperingatkan para pemuja benda-benda itu, bahwa berhala-berhala itu bukan saja tidak sederajat dengan mereka bahkan lebih rendah dari mereka. Berhala-berhala itu tidak memiliki kelengkapan tubuh seperti kaki, tangan, mata dan lain-lain sebagainya, yang dapat mengabulkan permohonan dan tuntutan pemujanya. Benda-benda itu tidak seperti penyembahnya yang keadaannya lebih sempurna dan lebih lengkap. Peringatan Allah ini merupakan ejekan dan penghinaan kepada kaum musyrikin, tetapi kaum musyrikin itu tidak menginsyafi keadaan diri mereka, bahkan mereka merasa sombong dan takabur. Mereka enggan menerima petunjuk dan pelajaran dari Rasul saw dengan alasan bahwa Rasul itu seorang manusia. Mereka berkata sesama mereka tentang kemanusiaan rasul, sebagimana difirmankan Allah:

Dan sungguh, jika kamu menaati manusia yang seperti kamu, niscaya kamu pasti rugi. (al-Muminun/23: 34)

Di sinilah kejanggalan pikiran mereka. Mereka menolak Rasul karena beliau seorang manusia. Padahal Rasul saw, mempunyai kelebihan pengetahuan, kebijaksanaan dan hidayah dari Allah dibanding dengan manusia lainnya. Mereka lebih mengutamakan patung-patung daripada seorang Rasul. Bahkan mengangkat patung-patung dan benda-benda sembahan sampai ke derajat tuhan. Maka Allah memerintahkan Rasul untuk menantang mereka dengan mengatakan kepada mereka bahwa jika benar berhala-berhalanya punya kekuatan, suruhlah mereka bersatu untuk membinasakan Rasul saw. Tidak perlu mereka memberi kesempatan menunggu Rasul saw membinasakannya lebih dulu. Tantangan yang demikian itu tidak akan terucapkan oleh Nabi saw sekiranya keimanan kepada pertolongan Allah tidak betul-betul diyakininya.

Tantangan demikian harus diucapkan. Sebab dalil-dalil dan alasan ilmiyah tidak bermanfaat lagi untuk menyatakan kebathilan kepercayaan masyarakat musyrikin Arab itu. Nabi Muhammad diperintahkan untuk meminta kepada mereka agar berhala-berhala mereka membinasakan nabi Muhammad. Tantangan yang demikian itu cukup membuat hati penyembah-penyembah berhala itu gentar.
text.196: Ayat ini menerangkan lanjutan ucapan Nabi Muhammad dihadapan kaum musyrikin, yaitu bahwa sesungguhnya Allah Yang menjadi pelindungnya, Yang mengurusi urusannya, dan Yang menjadi penolongnya. Allah Yang menurunkan Al-Quran, Yang menjelaskan keesaan-Nya dan yang mewajibkan manusia berbakti serta berdoa kepada-Nya dalam segala keadaan. Al-Quran itu membentangkan pula kekeliruan dan kebathilan penyembahan berhala. Karena itu Rasulullah saw tidak memperdulikan berhala-berhala itu dan tidak pula merasa takut kepadanya, meskipun orang-orang musyrikin menakut-nakuti dengan berhala itu. Allah juga akan memberikan pertolongan dan perlindungan-Nya kepada hamba-Nya yang saleh, yakni mereka yang memiliki jiwa yang bersih berkat kebersihan akidahnya, dan dari kebersihan jiwa itu lahir amal perbuatan yang luhur, berguna bagi kehidupan pribadi dan masyarakat.
text.197:
Allah swt menegaskan kembali pada kaum musyrikin bahwa berhala-berhala yang mereka harapkan pertolongannya itu tidak dapat berbuat apa-apa bahkan menolong diri mereka sendiri tidak dapat, apalagi menolong diri orang lain. Baik memberi manfaat, maupun menolak kemudharatan, seperti apa yang diperbuat Nabi Ibrahim as. Beliau menghancurkan patung-patung kaumnya, sehingga menjadi berkeping-keping. Patung-patung itu tidak dapat membela diri dan membalas dendam. 

Diceritakan oleh Ibnu Katsir, bahwa Muaz bin Amr bin al- Jamuh beserta Muaz bin Jabal ra, masuk agama Islam ketika Nabi Muhammad, tiba di Medinah. Keduanya masih muda-muda. Pada suatu malam mereka pergi menghancurkan patung-patung orang musyrikin dan dijadikan kayu bakar untuk para janda. Maksudnya agar kaumnya mengetahui dan mengambil pelajaran dari peristiwa itu.

Orang tuanya yang bernama Amr bin al-Jamuh seorang kepala suku, memiliki sebuah patung yang selalu disembahnya dan diberinya wangi-wangian. Pada suatu malam kedua anak muda itu mendatangi patung tersebut. Lalu patung itu dibalikkannya, kepalanya dibawah dan diberinya kotoran manusia. Besok harinya Amr bin Al Jamuh datang ke tempat patung sembahannya, dilihatnya apa yang telah terjadi. Patung itu kemudian dibersihkanya dan diberinya wangi-wangian lalu dia letakkan sebuah pedang di sampingnya. Berkatalah dia kepada patung itu: "Belalah dirimu". Tetapi keesokan harinya kedua anak muda itu kembali mengulangi perbuatannya dan orang tua itupun kembali pula berbuat seperti semula lagi.

Akhirnya kedua anak muda itu mengambil patung itu dan mengikatnya bersama anjing yang mati, lalu diletakkannya di dekat sumur yang dekat dengan tempat itu. Kemudian ketika orang tua itu datang lagi dan melihat apa yang terjadi atas patungnya, sadarlah dia bahwa agama yang dianutnya selama ini adalah agama yang bathil. Kemudian Amr bin Jamuh masuk agama Islam dan menjadi seorang muslim yang baik. Beliau mati syahid dalam Perang Uhud (Lihat Tafsir Ibnu Katsir jilid 2, hal 277).
text.198: Dalam ayat ini Allah menyatakan kembali bahwa meskipun orang musyrikin itu meminta berhala-berhala itu memberi petunjuk kepada mereka, namun berhala-berhala itu tidak akan mendengar permintaan itu. karena benda-benda itu tidak mempunyai pendengaran walaupun dia punya telinga. Kaum musyrikin itu melihat berhala-berhala itu memandang kepada mereka, padahal dia tidak melihat, karena berhala-berhala itu tidak punya penglihatan walaupun ia punya mata yang dipahat oleh pembuatnya.
text.199:
Dalam ayat ini Allah memerintahkan Rasul-Nya, agar berpegang teguh pada prinsip umum tentang moral dan hukum.

1. Sikap Pemaaf dan berlapang dada

Allah swt menyuruh Rasul-Nya agar beliau memaafkan dan berlapang terhadap perbuatan, tingkah laku dan akhlak manusia dan janganlah beliau meminta dari manusia apa yang sangat sukar bagi mereka sehingga mereka lari dari agama.

Sabda Rasullah saw:

"Mudahkanlah, jangan kamu persulit dan berilah kegembiraan, jangan kamu susahkan". (Riwayat al-Bukhari dan Muslim dari Abu Musa dan Muadz)

Termasuk prinsip agama, memudahkan, menjauhkan kesukaran dan segala hal yang menyusahkan manusia. Demikian pula halnya dalam bidang budi pekerti manusia banyak dipengaruhi lingkungannya. Bahkan banyak riwayat menyatakan bahwa yang dikehendaki pemaafan di sini ialah pemaafan dalam bidang akhlak atau budi pekerti (Tafsir Ibn Katsir dalam tafsir ayat tersebut)

Rasulullah berkata sehubungan dengan ayat ini:

"Apakah ini ya Jibril? Jawab Jibril, "Sesungguhnya Allah telah memerintahkan kamu agar memaafkan orang yang berbuat aniaya terhadapmu, memberi kepada orang yang tidak mau memberi kepadamu dan menyambung hubungan kepada orang yang memutuskannya." (Riwayat Ibn Jarir dan Ibn Abi Hatim, dari Ibn Ubay dari bapaknya)

2. Menyuruh manusia berbuat maruf (baik)

Pengertian urf pada ayat ini adalah maruf. Adapun Maruf adalah adat kebiasaan masyarakat yang baik, yang tidak bertentangan dengan ajaran agama Islam. Dalam Al-Quran kata"maruf" dipergunakan dalam hubungan hukum-hukum yang penting, seperti dalam hukum pemerintahan, hukum perkawinan. Dalam pengertian kemasyarakatan kata "maruf" dipergunakan dalam arti adat kebiasaan dan muamalah dalam suatu masyarakat. Karena itu ia berbeda-beda sesuai dengan perbedaan bangsa, negara, dan waktu. Di antara para ulama ada yang memberikan definisi "maruf" dengan apa yang dipandang baik melakukannya menurut tabiat manusia yang murni tidak berlawanan dengan akal pikiran yang sehat. Bagi kaum Muslimin yang pokok ialah berpegang teguh pada nash-nash yang kuat dari Al-Quran dan Sunnah. Kemudian mengindahkan adat kebiasaan dan norma yang hidup dalam masyarakat selama tidak bertentangan dengan nash agama secara jelas.

3. Tidak mempedulikan gangguan orang jahil

Yang dimaksud dengan orang jahil ialah orang yang selalu bersikap kasar dan menimbulkan gangguan-gangguan terhadap para Nabi, dan tidak dapat disadarkan. Allah memerintahkan kepada Rasul-Nya, agar menghindarkan diri dari orang-orang jahil, tidak melayani mereka, dan tidak membalas kekerasan mereka dengan kekerasan pula.
text.200:
Dalam ayat ini Allah menjelaskan tentang kemungkinan Nabi Muhammad digoda setan, lalu dia tidak dapat melaksanakan prinsip di atas. Oleh karena itu Allah memerintahkan kepada Rasul-Nya, agar selalu memohonkan perlindungan kepada Allah jika golongan setan datang, dengan membaca "Taawwuz", yaitu: 

"Aku berlindung kepada Allah dari godaan setan yang terkutuk".

Allah swt Maha Mendengar segala permohonan yang diucapkan dan Maha Mengetahui apa yang terlintas dalam jiwa seseorang, yang dapat mendorong dia berbuat kejahatan atau kesalahan. Jika doa itu dibaca orang yang tergoda itu dengan hati yang ikhlas dan penghambaan diri yang tulus kepada Allah, maka Allah akan mengusir setan dari dirinya, serta akan melindunginya dari godaan setan itu.

Firman Allah swt:

"Maka apabila engkau (Muhammad) hendak membaca Al-Quran, mohonlah perlindungan kepada Allah dari setan yang terkutuk. Sungguh, setan itu tidak ada akan berpengaruh terhadap orang yang beriman dan bertawakal kepada Tuhan". (an-Nahl/16:98-99)

Sabda Rasulullah saw:

"Tidak seorang pun di antara kamu sekalian melainkan didampingi temannya dari jenis jin. Berkatalah para sahabat: Engkau juga hai Rasulullah? Beliau menjawab, "Saya juga". Hanya Allah menolong aku menghadapinya maka selamatlah aku dari padanya." (Riwayat Muslim dari Aisyah ra. dan Ibnu Masud)

Meskipun dalam ayat ini perintah ditujukan kepada Rasul, namun perintah ini meliputi seluruh umatnya yang ada di dunia ini.
text.201:
Dalam ayat ini Allah menjelaskan reaksi orang-orang yang bertakwa bila digoda setan. Ayat ini memperkuat pula ayat sebelumnya tentang keharusan kita berlindung kepada Allah dari godaan setan.

Sesungguhnya orang yang bertakwa ialah orang yang beriman kepada yang gaib, mendirikan salat, menginfakkan sebagian dari rezekinya. Bila mereka merasa ada dorongan dalam dirinya untuk berbuat kemungkaran, mereka segera sadar bahwa yang demikian itu adalah godaan setan dan mereka segera mengucapkan doa istiadzah dan menyerahkan diri kepada Allah agar dipelihara dari tipu muslihat setan. Berkat kesadaran itu, mereka terhindar dari jurang kebinasaan dan jaring-jaring setan, karena mereka bisa menahan diri agar tidak jatuh ke dalam perangkap setan, sedang yang masuk perangkap setan itu hanyalah orang yang lalai kepada Allah dan kurang mawas diri. 

Senjata yang paling ampuh mengusir setan, ialah ingat dan muraqabah (mendekatkan diri) kepada Allah di dalam segala keadaan. Ingat selalu kepada Allah akan menanamkan ke dalam jiwa cinta kebenaran dan kebajikan, melemahkan kecenderungan negatif/buruk. Jiwa yang dipenuhi iman ialah jiwa yang sehat. Jiwa yang sehat seperti badan yang sehat yang punya kekebalan. Badan yang punya kekebalan, badan yang kuat, tidak mudah diserang penyakit. Bakteri-bakteri dan kuman penyakit tidak dapat berkembang biak dalam tubuh yang penuh dengan daya kekebalan itu. Demikian pula jiwa orang yang takwa, tidak mudah dikalahkan godaan setan. Orang yang bertakwa segera bereaksi terhadap rangsangan setan yang timbul dalam dirinya. Reaksi itu berupa ingatan kepada Allah disertai dengan kesadaran terhadap tipu muslihat setan dengan segala akibatnya.

Memelihara jiwa yang sehat dari godaan setan sama halnya dengan memelihara badan yang sehat, yakni memerlukan perawatan yang terus menerus agar tetap bersih dan sehat, memerlukan muraqabah yang tetap, ingat kepada Allah dalam segala keadaan. Dengan demikian setan tidak mendapat kesempatan mengganggu diri.
text.202: Ayat ini menerangkan bahwa orang jahil dan kafir membantu setan dalam menyesatkan dan berbuat kerusakan. Sebab orang-orang jahil itu selalu dipengaruhi setan dan tidak ingat kepada Allah. Jika timbul dalam diri mereka dorangan nafsu hewani, mereka melampiaskannya dalam bentuk tindakan dan perbuatan hewani. Tidak ada kekuatan jiwa yang membendung nafsu hewani itu. Karena itu mereka terus menerus melakukan kerusakan dan bergelimang dalam kesesatan.
text.203:
Dalam ayat ini diterangkan tingkah laku teman-teman setan dalam usaha mereka menentang Nabi Muhammad, bilamana wahyu tidak datang kepada Nabi Muhammad disebabkan keterlambatan turunnya ayat, maka orang-orang musyrikin itu mendesak Nabi Muhammad agar beliau menciptakan sendiri ayat-ayat itu. Desakan mereka itu sebenarnya mengandung arti pengingkaran terhadap Al-Quran yang diturunkan oleh Allah kepada Nabi Muhammad. Sebab mereka memandang Al-Quran itu ciptaan Nabi Muhammad belaka, karena itu bisa dibuat kapan saja. Maka Allah memerintahkan kepada Nabi untuk menjelaskan kepada mereka bahwa Al-Quran itu wahyu Allah yang diwahyukan kepadanya. Nabi hanya mengikuti apa yang diwahyukan kepadanya. Bukan haknya untuk mendesak Allah agar menciptakan sesuatu perkara, Nabi hanya dapat menunggu wahyu yang akan disampaikan kepadanya, untuk disampaikan pula kepada umatnya. Jika tidak ada dia tidak boleh mengubah sendiri Al-Quran karena Al-Quran itu adalah kalam Allah, dia mempunyai tiga fungsi bagi orang-orang yang beriman sebagaimana dijelaskan Allah dalam ayat ini.

Pertama

Sebagai bukti yang nyata dari Allah untuk menunjukkan keesaan-Nya, kenabian Muhammad dan hari Kiamat. Siapa yang memperhatikan dan merenungkan isi Al-Quran, tentu akan yakin bahwa Al-Quran itu dari Allah swt.

Kedua

Sebagai petunjuk atau pedoman yang membimbing manusia dalam mencari kebenaran dan jalan yang lurus.

Ketiga

Sebagai rahmat dalam kehidupan manusia dunia dan akhirat bagi orang-orang yang beriman. Al-Quran memberikan peraturan-peraturan dan ajaran-ajaran yang mudah dipahami dan mudah dilaksanakan oleh kaum Muslimin untuk kehidupan mereka sehari-hari.
text.204:
Diriwayatkan dari Abu Hurairah bahwa ayat ini diturunkan karena sahabat salat di belakang Rasulullah sambil berbicara. Allah dalam ayat ini memerintahkan orang-orang yang beriman agar mereka memberikan perhatian yang sungguh-sungguh kepada Al-Quran. Hendaklah mereka mendengarkan sebaik-baiknya ataupun isinya untuk dipahami, mengambil pelajaran-pelajaran dari padanya dan mengamalkannya dengan ikhlas.

Sabda Rasulullah saw:

Barangsiapa mendengarkan (dengan sungguh-sungguh) ayat dari Al-Quran, dituliskan baginya kebaikan yang berlipat ganda dan barang siapa membacanya, adalah baginya cahaya pada hari Kiamat." (Riwayat al-Bukhari dan Imam Ahmad dari Abu Hurairah)

Hendaklah orang-orang mukmin itu bersikap tenang sewaktu Al-Quran dibacakan, sebab di dalam ketenangan itulah mereka dapat merenungkan isinya. Janganlah pikiran mereka melayang-layang sewaktu Al-Quran diperdengarkan, sehingga tidak dapat memahami ayat-ayat itu dengan baik. Allah akan menganugerahkan rahmat-Nya kepada kaum Muslimin bilamana mereka memenuhi perintah Allah tersebut dan menghayati isi Al-Quran.

Ada beberapa pendapat seputar perintah untuk mendengarkan dan bersikap tenang sewaktu Al-Quran dibacakan:

1.Wajib mendengarkan dan bersikap tenang ketika Al-Quran dibacakan berdasarkan perintah tersebut, baik di dalam salat ataupun diluar salat. Demikianlah pendapat Hasan al-Bashri dan Abu Muslim al-Ashfahani.

2.Wajib mendengarkan dan bersikap tenang, tetapi khusus pada bacaan-bacaan Rasul saw di zaman beliau dan bacaan iman dalam salat, serta bacaan khatib dalam khutbah Jumat. 

3.Mendengarkan bacaan Al-Quran di luar salat dan khutbah seperti resepsi dipandang sangat dianjurkan agar kita mendapat rahmat Allah.
text.205:
Dalam ayat ini Allah memerintahkan Rasul beserta umatnya untuk menyebut nama Allah atau berzikir kepada-Nya. Baik zikir itu dengan membaca Al-Quran, tasbih, tahlil, doa, ataupun pujian lain-lainnya menurut tuntunan agama, dengan tadharru dan suara lembut pada setiap waktu terutama pagi dan sore, agar kita tidak tergolong orang yang lalai. Kemudian Allah menggariskan bagi kita adab dan cara berzikir atau menyebut nama Allah itu sebagai berikut:

1. Zikir itu yang paling baik dilakukan dengan suara lembut, karena hal ini lebih mudah mengantar untuk tafakur yang baik.

Diriwayatkan bahwa dalam suatu perjalanan. Nabi mendengar orang berdoa dengan suara yang keras, berkatalah beliau kepada mereka itu:

"Hai manusia kasihanilah dirimu, sesungguhnya kamu tidak menyeru kepada yang tuli atau yang jauh dari padamu. Sesungguhnya Yang kamu seru itu adalah Allah Maha Mendengar dan Maha Dekat. Dia lebih dekat kepadamu dari leher (unta) kendaraanmu". (Riwayat Ibnu Majah)

2. Zikir itu dapat dilakukan dalam hati atau dengan lisan, karena zikir dalam hati menunjukkan keikhlasan, jauh daripada riya, dan dekat pada perkenaan Allah swt. Zikir dapat dilakukan dengan lisan, lisan mengucapkan dan hati mengikutinya.

3. Zikir dapat pula dilakukan secara berjamaah, dengan tujuan untuk mendidik umat agar terbiasa melakukan zikir.
text.206:
Dalam ayat ini Allah menjelaskan bahwa malaikat yang kedudukannya mulia di sisi Tuhan tiadalah merasa berat dan enggan menyembah Allah. Hendaklah manusia mencontoh ketaatan malaikat itu kepada Tuhan. Para malaikat itu selalu mensucikan Allah dari sifat-sifat yang tidak layak bagi-Nya, dan dari menyembah berhala-berhala. Para malaikat sujud dan salat kepada Allah swt.

Ayat ini termasuk ayat sajadah yang pertama dalam Al-Quran. Di sunatkan bagi orang Islam melakukan sujud setelah membaca atau mendengar ayat ini dibacakan.

Abu Darda meriwayatkan sebagai berikut:

"Bahwasanya Rasulullah saw memandang ayat ini salah satu ayat sajadah dalam Al-Quran". (Riwayat Ibnu Majah)

en.name: The Most High
en.source: Aplikasi Quran Kementrian Agama Republik Indonesia

text.1: Regarding the interpretation of the verse "Alif Lam Mim Sad," see volume I of Al-Qur'an dan Tafsirnya concerning the interpretation of the beginning of surahs with hijaiyah letters.
text.2:
This verse explains that the book revealed to Muhammad, containing guidance and direction, is to give a warning to the believers. Muhammad should never feel sad facing the challenges, resistance, mockery, and other things from the polytheists in conveying the message entrusted to him. He must be patient in facing them. The existence of challenges from the polytheists, causing Muhammad's chest to become constricted because of them, is known by Allah as affirmed in His word:

"And We already know that your breast is constrained by what they say." (al-Hijr/15: 97)

But he is commanded to be patient, to remain steadfast in facing them as were the previous messengers.

Allah's word:

"So be patient, [O Muhammad], as were those of determination among the messengers and do not be impatient for them." (al-Ahqaf/46: 35)

The book must be used as a lesson and a reminder for the believers, because the reminder will bring benefit and influence to them.

"And remind, for indeed, the reminder benefits the believers." (Adz-Dzariyat/51: 55)
text.3: In this verse, there is a command for the believers to follow what has been revealed to Muhammad by Allah, who controls and regulates all their movements, whether the command is to do something or to refrain from doing something, because what He has commanded contains goodness, truth, prosperity, and happiness. And, they should never follow teachings other than the teachings of Allah, nor invitations that contradict the provisions that He has outlined, because such things are harmful to them and will lead their followers to a path of error and corrupt their *akidah*/morals, and so on. Even though the things mentioned above have become a reality and witnessed with their own eyes, not many people realize it, take lessons and *iktibar* from it; instead, they continue to follow the desires of their *nafs* and the invitations of the devil they serve.
text.4:
This verse explains that there are many lands that have been destroyed and their inhabitants annihilated due to their disobedience. They opposed, rebelled against, and rejected the messengers of Allah who were sent to them to deliver good news and warnings. Allah says:

"And how many a city did We destroy while it was committing wrong, so it is [now] fallen upon its roofs, and [how many] a deserted well and [how many] a lofty palace." (al-Hajj/22: 45)

"And how many a city which was insolent in its [way of] living did We destroy, and that is their residences - not inhabited after them except a little. And We were the inheritors." (al-Qashash/28: 58)

When a land is to be destroyed, the punishment and torment of Allah comes to the inhabitants of that land while they are heedless and do not expect it at all, because there are no prior signs. Sometimes the punishment comes at night, when they are enjoying themselves, feeling secure, as was the case with the people of Prophet Lut. Sometimes it comes during the day, when they are resting and sleeping, as was the case with the people of Prophet Shu'aib.

Allah says:

"Until, when the earth has taken on its adornment and is beautified and its people suppose that they are capable of [exploiting] it, there comes to it Our command by night or by day, and We make it as a harvest, as if it had not flourished yesterday. Thus do We explain in detail the signs for a people who give thought." (Yunus/10: 24)

His saying:

"Then did the people of the cities feel secure from Our punishment coming to them at night while they were asleep? Or did the people of the cities feel secure from Our punishment coming to them in the morning while they were at play?" (al-A'raf/7: 97-98)
text.5:
This verse explains that the only complaint of the people who have been afflicted with torment is that they acknowledge the injustice, mistakes, and disobedience they have committed. Only then do they realize and regret, and hope for a way out of the disaster that has befallen them. Of course, their awareness and regret will be of no benefit and of no use anymore; as Allah says:

And how many a city which was unjust have We destroyed, and raised up after them another people. And when they felt Our punishment, behold, they fled from it. Do not flee but return to that wherein you were given ease and to your dwellings, that you may be questioned. They said, "O woe to us! Indeed, we have been wrongdoers." And that cry of theirs ceased not till We made them as reaped harvest, extinct. (al-Anbiya'/21: 11-15)
text.6:
This verse explains that in the afterlife, all communities to whom a messenger was sent will be questioned, as Allah says:

"So by your Lord, We will surely question them all, about what they used to do." (al-Hijr/15: 92-93)

First, the messengers who were sent to them will be questioned, followed by questions about the extent to which they responded to and implemented the calls of those messengers. Allah says:

"O company of jinn and mankind, did there not come to you messengers from among yourselves, relating to you My verses and warning you of this Day of yours?" They will say, "We bear witness against ourselves." And worldly life deluded them, and they will bear witness against themselves that they were disbelievers. (al-An'am/6: 130)

His saying:

"[Mention] the Day when Allah will assemble the messengers and say, "What was the response you received?"" (al-Ma'idah/5: 109)

The question is posed to the rebellious and those who commit sins, not because Allah does not know or is unaware of their condition, but all of this is done solely to obtain their acknowledgment of the messengers who were sent to them and to reveal their flaws and defects, so that they have no excuse not to be punished or cast into hell.

Imam ar-Razi said that they are not actually asked about the deeds they committed in the world, because all of that is already known through the records of the angels assigned to that task, so that no human action, from the greatest to the smallest, escapes their record. Rather, what is asked is the reason that caused them to abandon Allah's commands. This verse does not contradict the verses that explain that humans and jinn will not be questioned about their sins, nor will those who commit sins, as in Allah's saying:

"So on that Day man and jinn will not be asked about his sin." (ar-Rahman/55: 39)

and His saying:

"So the criminals will not be asked about their sins." (al-Qashash/28: 78)

In this verse, Allah explains that not only will the communities to whom a Messenger was sent be asked to what extent they implemented the call of the messenger, but also the messengers who were sent to a community will be asked to what extent their call was well received and implemented by their community, as Allah says:

"[Mention] the Day when Allah will assemble the messengers and say, "What was the response you received?"" (al-Ma'idah/5: 109)

The question addressed to the messengers in the afterlife is a question whose answer constitutes an acknowledgment and testimony to the call that has been conveyed to their community, and the community's disobedience to the content of this call.
text.7:
This verse explains that to them, both to the messengers and to the people who have received the messengers' call, will be recounted in the future the things they have done, because all of that is known to Allah, and all of it has been recorded in the record book of the recording angels. Nothing escapes the angels' recording, as Allah says:

"And they will say, "Oh, woe to us! What is this record that leaves nothing, small or great, but has accounted for it?" And they will find whatever they did present [before them]. And your Lord does injustice to no one." (al-Kahf/18: 49)

Allah always witnesses their movements and all their actions at all times. Allah hears what they say, sees what they do, knows all their actions, whether they do them openly or secretly. Allah says:

"While Allah is with them when they spend the night in such as He does not approve of in speech. And ever is Allah, encompassing of what they do." (an-Nisa'/4: 108)

This questioning is not to ask for clarification about something Allah does not know, but solely to reproach their deeds and behavior.
text.8:
This verse explains the existence of scales on the Day of Judgment. We are obligated to believe in these scales because they will determine the magnitude, heaviness, and lightness of a person's deeds. The scales on the Day of Judgment will be the most just scales, and cheating in those scales will be impossible.

And We will place the scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection, so no soul will be treated unjustly at all. (al-Anbiya'/21: 47)

Whoever has heavy scales of good deeds, because the faith they possess is true faith. Their worship of Allah is performed as much as possible with humility and sincerity, and their relationship with fellow humans is very good. They help those who need help, assist in the construction of mosques, madrasas, Islamic boarding schools (pesantren), and other buildings used to improve and enhance the morals of the community, care for orphans, and so on. Such a person will be fortunate in the Hereafter, feeling satisfied to receive all the rewards for their deeds in the world, as Allah says:

Meaning:

Then as for one whose scales are heavy [with good deeds], He will be in a pleasant life. (al-Qari'ah/101: 6-7)
text.9:
Whoever has light scales of deeds, due to their denial, their faith is weak, so they commit many religious violations; worship is abandoned; good deeds are wasted, and what they enjoy are religious prohibitions, much deception, hurting the hearts of fellow humans, antagonizing their neighbors, neglecting orphans, letting those around them go hungry and suffer, as long as they are full and happy. Such a person will lose in the afterlife and will be thrown into the blazing fire of hell, as Allah says:

"But as for him whose balance (of good deeds) will be light, His abode will be Hawiyah (the pit, i.e., Hell). And what will make you know what it is? (It is) a scorching fire!" (al-Qari'ah/101: 8-11)

What is weighed are deeds, as Abu Ishak az-Zajjaj said, "The Ahlus Sunnah have agreed on the existence of the scales, and it is the deeds of the servant that will be weighed in the afterlife. The scales have a tongue and two pans." Abu Ishak's statement is based on the words of the Prophet Muhammad saw:

"The scales will be set up on the Day of Resurrection, and good deeds and evil deeds will be weighed. Whoever's good deeds outweigh their evil deeds, even by the weight of a seed, will enter Paradise, and whoever's evil deeds outweigh their good deeds, even by the weight of a seed, will enter Hell." (Narrated by Abu Daud and at-Tirmidhi from Jabir r.a.)
text.10:
In this verse, Allah affirms some of the many blessings He has bestowed upon His servants, namely that He has provided this earth for humans to inhabit and reside upon, freely striving within the boundaries He has prescribed, and equipped with the necessities of life. Then He perfected it with various other provisions so that they can live on earth happily and peacefully, such as plants of various kinds, animals, both those that are permissible to eat and those that are not, birds both in the air and on land, fish both in the sea, in lakes, and in other fish farming locations, fresh water for drinking, used for washing clothes and other needs, drinks and foods of various tastes and aromas to satisfy individual preferences. Indeed, everything on this earth is intended for humans, as Allah says:

"He is the One Who created everything on the earth for you." (al-Baqarah/2: 29)

To fulfill the necessities of life, one certainly cannot remain in one place, but moves from one place to another. For this purpose, various means of transportation and communication are provided, which develop and advance in accordance with the progress of science and technology for their use, such as cars with all kinds of shapes and beauty, airplanes, ships, and submarines, trains, and so on, which are countless. No human being can give a definite number about the abundance of these blessings, even with a computer. Allah says:

"And if you should count the favors of Allah, you could not enumerate them." (Ibrahim/14: 34)

All of the above blessings and favors are to fulfill the needs of physical life, both individually and collectively, which will be used as a stepping stone to fulfill and maintain the well-being of spiritual life for the purity of oneself and to prepare oneself for eternal life in the hereafter and to obtain endless blessings and eternal happiness. For all these countless blessings and favors, it is obligatory for humans to be grateful, to be grateful to their Creator, namely Allah swt, and never to deny Him, as Allah says:

"Therefore remember Me; I will remember you. And be grateful to Me, and do not deny Me." (al-Baqarah/2: 152)

How few are the people who can realize and be aware of this. In general, people assume that what they have achieved and obtained is the result of their intelligence, their diligent efforts, not from Allah, and few of them are grateful:

"And few of My servants are grateful." (Saba'/34: 13)

Being grateful to Allah is not enough by simply saying Alhamdulillah wasysyukru lillah; but it must be accompanied by good deeds, namely by utilizing these blessings in matters that are pleasing and liked by Allah, beneficial to fellow human beings, and obeying all His commands and avoiding all His prohibitions.
text.11:
This verse explains that Allah created Adam a.s., who would be followed by his descendants. Regarding the creation of humans, the Qur'an has narrated in detail, both the creation of the first human, namely Adam, and the creation of his descendants. Regarding the creation of Adam, the Qur'an has informed that Prophet Adam was created through four stages before the stage of breathing the spirit. The four stages are: a. Turab Phase, b. Thin Phase, c. Hama' Masnun Phase, and d. Shalshal Phase. The following is the explanation.

First Phase: The Phase of Soil that has not been mixed with water (turab)

There are several verses that explain about this phase as found in Surah al-Kahf/18: 37, al-hajj/22: 5, ar-Rum/30: 20, Fajir/35: 11, Gafir/40: 67, and Ali 'Imran/3: 59. Two of the six places are in the Madaniyah surah, namely Ali 'Imran/3 and al-hajj/22, the rest are in the Makiyah surahs.

One of these verses is:

Indeed, the example of Jesus to Allah is like that of Adam. He created him from dust; then He said to him, "Be," and he was. (Ali 'Imran/3: 59).

In one of the hadiths narrated from Abu Daud and at-Tirmidzi, it is mentioned that the soil that became the main ingredient for creating Adam was taken from various kinds and colors of soil found in all layers of the earth.

In the hadith it is mentioned:

Allah created Adam from a handful (of soil) taken from all corners of the earth. Therefore, Adam's descendants are in accordance with the (color) of the earth. Among them are red, white and black (al-Khazin II: 118). Human nature is also different, some are gentle and some are harsh.

The various skin colors of humans are emphasized in Surah ar-Rum/30: 22 which reads:

And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the diversity of your languages and your colors. Indeed in that are signs for those of knowledge. (ar-Rum/30: 22)

Second Phase: The Phase of Soil mixed with water (thin)

This second phase is found in 8 places in 7 surahs, namely: al-An'am/6: 2, al-A'raf/7: 12, al-Mu'minun/23: 12, as-Sajdah/32: 7, ash-shaffat/37: 11, shad/38: 71, 76, and al-Isra'/17: 61. All of them are Makiyah surahs.

One of these verses is:

It is He who created you from clay and then decreed a term [for you]... (al-An'am/6: 2)

The thin or clay phase is the phase where the soil is mixed with water. Because water is a prerequisite for all living creatures.

Third Phase: The Phase of Black Mud (hama' Masnun)

This phase occurs after the second phase lasts for a long time, becoming black mud that smells and changes shape.

This phase is mentioned three times in Surah al-hijr/15, namely in verses 26, 28 and 33. Verse 26 reads:

And We did certainly create man out of clay from an altered black mud. (al-hijr/15: 26)

Fourth Phase: The Phase of Pottery (shalshal kal Fakhkhar)

This phase is narrated by the Qur'an in four places. Three places in Surah al-hijr which coincide with the third phase. While the fourth is found in Surah ar-Rahman/55: 14.

In this surah, Allah says:

He created man from clay like [that of] pottery. (ar-Rahman/55: 14)

Black mud (hama' masnun) as in the third phase, is then shaped like a human in a hollow or empty state.

The human form created by Allah is the best form of the existing animals. In Surah At-Tin/95: 4, Allah says:

We have certainly created man in the best of stature. (at-Tin/95: 4)

This condition (the prospective human who has been formed) if it dries due to the heat of the sun, for example, is called shalshal. It is named so because this object will make a sound (shalshalah) when the wind blows.

After this phase, the next phase begins, namely the phase of breathing the spirit where the "dummy" made of clay, with Allah's permission, finally becomes a living and moving human being called "basyar" (al-Khazin III: 64, al-Maragi XIV: 21).
text.12: Allah asked Iblis, "What prevented you from prostrating when I commanded you?" With utter arrogance, the devil answered, "I will not prostrate to Adam to honor him, because I am higher and more noble than Adam. You created me from fire while You created Adam from clay." Iblis considered fire to be more noble than clay.
text.13: After Allah saw the behavior of Iblis, who was arrogant, considering himself more noble than Adam (peace be upon him), which led him to be disobedient and defiant and not obedient to His command, then he was ordered by Allah to descend from Paradise, the place where he was at that time, because that place is intended for His sincere and humble servants and is not a place to display arrogance and pride. This was then followed by an order for him to leave that place, because he had become one of the despised creatures, unsuitable for that noble and honorable place.
text.14: When Iblis heard Allah's command that he descend and leave Paradise, he requested that his lifespan be extended and that he not be made to die yet, and also that his descendants be spared until the Day of Resurrection in the Hereafter, so that this long and ample time could be used in the best way to tempt and mislead Adam and his descendants during their lives in the world.
text.15:
Iblis's request to remain alive along with his descendants as long as Adam's descendants still exist in the world was granted by Allah only until the first trumpet is blown, when all the inhabitants of the earth will die simultaneously, including Iblis and his descendants, and its contents will be destroyed. At the blowing of the second trumpet, all humans will come back to life and rise from death.

Allah says:

(Iblis) said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected." (Allah) said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved, Until the Day of the time well-known (the Day of Judgment)." (Shad/38: 79-81)

He also says:

And the Horn will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will fall dead except whom Allah wills. Then it will be blown again, and at once they will be standing, looking on. (az-Zumar/39: 68)
text.16:
This verse explains Iblis's threat to Adam and his descendants. Because Allah had punished Iblis due to his arrogance and pride, he swore to strive with all his might to prevent Adam's descendants from the straight path in order to mislead them, as mentioned in Allah's word:

(Iblis) answered, "By Your might, I will surely mislead them all." (shad/38: 82)

Iblis will strive to prevent and hinder Adam's descendants from taking the straight path, the path of truth, the path that pleases Allah, the path that will lead them to happiness in this world and the hereafter.
text.17:
Iblis saw that merely hindering the descendants of Adam a.s. from following the straight path was not enough. Therefore, he would come to them and attack them from all directions; from the front and from the back; from the right and left, which he believed were the weaknesses of Adam's descendants. Iblis was confident that with such a strategy, many of them would be tempted, influenced, and deceived, so that the faith in their hearts would weaken and fade, religious teachings would gradually be doubted and denied, the Day of Judgment and all its events would be rejected, and good deeds would be abandoned. They would be unable to control their desires; on the contrary, they would be controlled by their desires. Allah warns with His words:

"I will surely fill Hell with you and with those of them that follow you, all together." (Shad/38: 85)

Iblis's plan and target, as mentioned above, were truly successful:

"And Iblis did indeed find his assumption about them to be correct, and they followed him, except for a party of believers." (Saba'/34: 20)
text.18:
This verse explains once again about Allah's curse upon Iblis and His expulsion of him from Paradise in a state of humiliation and being cursed. Whoever from the descendants of Adam is influenced by Iblis and they follow his will, taking a path of error, deviating from the creed of tawhid to a belief in shirk, they will be entered by Him into Hell together with Iblis. Allah says:

(Iblis) answered, "By Your might, I will surely mislead them all, except for Your chosen servants among them." (shad/38: 82-83)
text.19: This verse explains that after Allah ordered Iblis to leave Paradise because of his arrogance and pride, He then commanded Adam to reside in Paradise with his wife, Siti Hawa, and permitted them to eat whatever was in it to their heart's content, except for one specific tree within it. If they violated this prohibition, then they would be considered zalim because they had committed a transgression.
text.20: When Iblis knew and saw the vast freedom given to Adam and his wife in Paradise, and the many pleasures, he felt unhappy and his envy and hatred arose. He began to try to deceive Adam and his wife, so that the freedom and pleasure that Allah had given to Adam and his wife in Paradise would be lost and taken away from them. Finally, he found a way, and he whispered in their ears: "O Adam, do you know why Allah forbade you both from approaching that tree and eating its fruit? Actually, the prohibition is intended so that you two will not be like angels who have advantages over other creatures, such as the power to live forever, not die, and so on, and so that you will not remain and live in Paradise freely and enjoy yourselves to your heart's content. So, if you two want to be like angels and remain in this Paradise happily and peacefully with complete freedom, then eat the fruit of the tree that you are forbidden to approach."
text.21: To strengthen his evil whispers and deceptions, he swore to Adam and Eve that he was truly a sincere advisor who genuinely desired their happiness and that what he was advising was true. It is important to remember that the Qur'an does not mention the name of Adam's wife.
text.22:
Iblis showed his sincerity, so Adam did not see anything suspicious at all. What Iblis presented and suggested was nothing but lies and deception, so they were both influenced by the persuasion of the deceitful Iblis, and they ate the fruit of the tree that Allah had forbidden them to approach. Then they completely forgot their position and Allah's prohibition to them, as Allah says:

"And We had already made a covenant with Adam before, but he forgot; and We found in him no determination." (Taha/20: 115)

The Qur'an does not mention who ate the forbidden fruit first, whether it was Adam or Hawa. Therefore, searching for information about this is not important.

After this incident, Allah rebuked Adam for disregarding His prohibition and not obeying Him, so that he was deceived and followed the persuasion of the deceitful Iblis. Then Allah warned him, "Did I not forbid you both from approaching that tree and eating its fruit, and did I not emphasize to you that Satan is your clear enemy, if you follow his will and desire, I will take you out of a spacious, pleasant and happy life into a life full of difficulties, suffering and hardship." In line with this, Allah says:

"Then We said, 'O Adam! Indeed, this is an enemy to you and to your wife. So let him not remove you both from Paradise and cause you to suffer.'" (Taha/20: 117)
text.23:
After Adam and his wife realized the mistake they had made, which was heeding the invitation of Satan and abandoning Allah's command, he immediately repented, regretting his actions. Allah taught them both a prayer to ask for forgiveness. Then, with all humility and full devotion, they prayed.

They both said, "Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves, and if You do not forgive us and have mercy upon us, we will surely be among the losers." (al-A'raf/7: 23)

Thanks to the words of prayer that truly came from the depths of their hearts with full awareness and sincerity, Allah granted their prayer, forgave their sins, and bestowed mercy upon them. Allah says:

Then Adam received some words from his Lord, and He accepted his repentance. Indeed, He is the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful. (al-Baqarah/2: 37)
text.24:
Allah then accepted the repentance of Adam and his wife, and commanded them both to leave Paradise and descend to Earth. Allah strengthened his faith and accepted his repentance because the prophet is *ma'shum* (protected from sin), capable of error but incapable of remaining in error because Allah corrects him. After his repentance was accepted, he became a chosen one again and received guidance from Allah, as in His saying:

"And Adam disobeyed his Lord and erred. Then his Lord chose him and turned to him in forgiveness and guided him. He (Allah) said, "Descend, both of you, from Paradise together..." (Taha/20: 121-123)

It has become *sunatullah* that every bad deed will have bad consequences. On this earth, there will be enmity, some will be enemies of others. Iblis and his companions will always be hostile to the descendants of Adam. Conversely, the descendants of Adam must always be vigilant and continue to view and treat Iblis as a very dangerous enemy, because if they do not, they will be thrown into Hell. Allah says:

"Indeed, Satan is an enemy to you, so take him as an enemy. He only invites his party to be among the companions of the Blaze." (Fathir/35: 6)

They will live and settle on Earth, equipped with sources of livelihood that bring them pleasure until the time determined by Allah, which is when their appointed term ends and the Day of Judgment arrives, according to the word of Allah:

"And We have certainly established you upon the earth and made for you therein means of livelihood..." (al-A'raf/7: 10)
text.25:
This verse explains that it is on this earth that they will live for the duration of their allotted lifespan, and it is on this earth that they will die when their appointed time comes, a decree that cannot be altered, neither advanced nor postponed, as Allah says:

"And for every nation is a [specified] term. So when their term has come, they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede [it]." (al-A'raf/7: 34)

And also His saying:

"But never will Allah delay a soul when its time has come." (al-Munafiqun/63: 11)

Furthermore, it is on this earth that they will be resurrected, and this verse 25 is in line with Allah's saying:

"From the earth We created you, and into it We will return you, and from it We will extract you another time." (Thaha/20: 55)
text.26:
In this verse, Allah calls upon the descendants of Adam and reminds them of the numerous blessings He has bestowed upon them so that they do not commit disobedience, but rather that they should be mindful of Him, wherever they may be, in accordance with the saying of Prophet Muhammad ﷺ:

"Be mindful of Allah wherever you are." (Narrated by at-Tirmidhi from Mu'adh bin Jabal)

Allah is the One who sends down rain from the sky, which causes the growth of cotton, flax, wool, and so on, all of which can be made into clothing after being processed to cover our *aurat*, our bodies, and to protect us from heat and cold, and used in warfare to withstand weapons (armor). Clothing can also be made beautiful as adornment, something that Allah loves, as the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ said:

"Indeed, Allah is beautiful and loves beauty." (Narrated by Muslim and at-Tirmidhi from Ibn Mas'ud)

All of this constitutes outward clothing and beauty. Besides that, there is another type of clothing that is spiritual in nature, which is far better than the outward clothing mentioned earlier, because it can gather all kinds of goodness, and that is *taqwa* (mindfulness/fear) of Allah.

The Prophet Muhammad ﷺ said:

"Be mindful of Allah, for indeed *taqwa* gathers all goodness." (Narrated by Abu Ya'la from Abu Sa'id)

With *taqwa*, Allah always gives us guidance to be able to overcome and emerge from the difficulties we face. He will provide us with sustenance from directions we never expected before and always ease our affairs, as Allah says:

"And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him a way out. And will provide for him from where he does not expect." (ath-Thalaq/65: 2-3)

Allah says:

"And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him of his matter ease." (Ath-Thalaq/65: 4)

All the blessings that Allah has bestowed, such as providing clothing, are signs of Allah's power and prove His goodness to the descendants of Adam (peace be upon him). Therefore, it is fitting that we always remember Allah, be grateful for His blessings, avoid the temptations of Satan, and not be excessive in speech and so on.
text.27:
This verse calls upon the descendants of Adam not to be negligent and heedless, forgetting and wasting themselves, not purifying themselves, and to fortify themselves with piety (taqwa). They should always remember Allah, because if they do not, their hearts will rust like iron. Thus, they will have the strength of steel to face the temptations and seductions of Satan and be saved from his deception, and they will not experience the misfortune that befell the parents of mankind, namely Adam, peace be upon him, and his wife, so that both of them were expelled from Paradise, their clothes were removed so that their private parts were visible. Satan and his followers have been continuously hostile to the descendants of Adam for generations. He is constantly spying and watching, wherever their weaknesses lie, that is where he inserts his needle as a temptation and deception. He is a very dangerous enemy, because he sees them, while they do not see him. He is more dangerous than an ordinary enemy that can be seen because these outward enemies can be known where they are and where they are going, even more dangerous than an enemy in disguise. He flows in the human body like the flow of blood, as the Prophet Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him, said:

"Indeed, Satan flows in the body of the descendants of Adam as blood flows in the body." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Anas)

Satan is no different from the danger of invisible diseases except with a microscope, which are usually transmitted by flies or mosquitoes that are put into food and drinks or into the human body through the blood. It penetrates into the body without being known, the consequences of which are very sad, because it is difficult to recover in a short time and there is a possibility that it will not recover at all. This is different from diseases that can be seen with the naked eye, such as scabies and so on, which can be treated quickly and can be cured in a short time. The anxiety that results in bad consequences as mentioned above can only happen to people who have little or no faith, because they are the ones who will become his prey and to them, Allah has made Satan their master.
text.28:
This verse explains that those who do not believe in Allah, and those who have made Satan their leader, when they commit evil deeds, such as denying Allah and associating partners with Him, they offer excuses and justifications, "This is what we know and what we found from our ancestors. We only follow what they have done, and even Allah has commanded us to do so, and we only obey His command." Their admission is clearly unjustifiable, because Allah has perfect attributes, it is impossible and unreasonable that He would command and order them to commit evil and vile deeds such as those mentioned above. In reality, the one who commands them to commit evil and vile deeds is none other than Satan, as Allah says:

"Satan threatens you with poverty and orders you to commit evil (stinginess)..." (al-Baqarah/2: 268)

They utter words directed at Allah, that He is the One who commands them to commit evil and vile deeds. That is an unfounded statement that is not based on knowledge, even though they will be held accountable for it later in the Hereafter, as Allah says:

"And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart - about all those will be questioned." (al-Isra'/17: 36)
text.29:
This verse corrects their error, proven by Allah commanding Prophet Muhammad to say to them, "Indeed, Allah only commands me to be just, to pray at every time, to be steadfast, sincere, and good in all things," as Allah says:

Indeed, Allah orders justice and good conduct and giving to relatives and forbids immorality and bad conduct and oppression. (an-Nahl/16: 90)

Allah commands them to direct their faces towards the Ka'bah, which has been designated as the qibla for everyone who prays, whether in the mosque or elsewhere, with full sincerity, because an act without sincerity will not be accepted by Allah, as the Prophet Muhammad said:

"Indeed, Allah will not accept any deed except that which is done sincerely for (seeking) His pleasure." (Narrated by an-Nasa'i from Abu Umamah)

To encourage them to always remember and obey Allah, not to be influenced by the invitations and temptations of Satan, they must always remember Allah. This is because Allah created them in the beginning, and to Him they will return. On the Day of Judgment, they will be held accountable for all the deeds they have done in the world.

And you have certainly come to Us alone as We created you the first time, and you have left behind you all that We bestowed upon you. (al-An'am/6: 94)
text.30:
Mankind is divided into two groups. The first group is those who have been given guidance by Allah in this world to perform prayer (salat), worship Him sincerely, and not associate partners with Him in anything. The second group, however, is those who have gone astray because they followed the invitation of Satan and abandoned the commands of Allah, their Creator. It is Satan that they have taken as their protector, not Allah. Strangely, they are already astray, treading a path forbidden by Allah, doing deeds that are not pleasing to Him, yet they still think that they are receiving guidance. Such people are the most losers, as Allah says:

Say, "Shall we [believers] inform you of the greatest losers as to [their] deeds? [They are] those whose effort is lost in worldly life, while they think that they are doing well in work." (al-Kahf/18: 103-104)
text.31:
In this verse, Allah commands people to wear *zinah* (clean and beautiful clothing) when entering mosques and performing worship, such as prayer, *thawaf*, and others.

What is meant by wearing *zinah* is wearing clothing that can cover the *aurat* while fulfilling the conditions of *hijab*. It is even more polite if the clothing, besides being clean and good, is also beautiful, which can add to a person's beauty in worshiping Allah, just as a person usually dresses up by wearing beautiful clothes when going to invitations and other places. So, to go to places of worship to worship Allah is certainly more appropriate, even more preferable. This depends on a person's willingness and ability, as well as awareness. If a person only has one piece of clothing, enough to cover the *aurat* in worship, that is sufficient. But if a person has quite a lot of clothes, then it is more preferable if they wear the good ones. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said:

"When one of you performs prayer, let him wear two cloths, because for Allah it is more fitting for a person to dress up. If there are not two cloths, then one cloth is enough to wear for prayer. Do not wrap yourself up in prayer like the wrapping of the Jews." (Narrated by ath-Thabrani and al-Baihaqi from Ibn 'Umar)

It is narrated from Hasan, the grandson of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him), that when he was about to perform prayer, he wore the best clothes he had. When he was asked about it, he replied, "Allah is beautiful, loves beauty, so I wear good clothes."

In this verse, Allah regulates the matter of eating and drinking. If in the time of *Jahiliyah*, people who performed *hajj* only ate filling food, not good and healthy food that could add nutrients and vitamins needed by the body, then with the revelation of this verse, food and drink must be perfected in nutrition and regulated in the timing of consumption while maintaining health. That way, people are stronger in performing worship. This verse explains that wearing good clothes, eating good food, and drinking beneficial drinks are in the context of regulating and maintaining health in order to worship Allah well. Because physical health has a lot to do with food and drink. Excessive food and drink result in impaired health. Therefore, Allah forbids excess in eating and drinking.

The prohibition of excess contains several meanings, including:

1.  Do not be excessive in the portion of eating and drinking itself. Because eating and drinking in excessive portions and exceeding the limits will bring disease. Eat when you feel hungry, and when you have eaten, do not be too full. Likewise with drinks, drink when you feel thirsty, and when the thirst disappears, stop drinking, even if the appetite for eating or drinking is still there.

2.  Do not be excessive in spending to buy food or drinks, because it will bring losses. If expenses are greater than income, it will cause a lot of debt. Therefore, everyone must try not to let the expenses exceed the income.

3.  Also included in excess is eating and drinking what Allah has forbidden. In this regard, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said:

"Eat, drink, give charity, and dress in a way that is not arrogant and not excessive. Indeed, Allah loves to see the use of His blessings upon His servant." (Narrated by Ahmad, at-Tirmidhi, and al-Hakim from Abu Hurairah)

Excessive actions that exceed the limits, besides being destructive and detrimental, are also disliked by Allah. Every action that Allah does not like, if it is done anyway, will certainly bring danger.
text.32:
During the Jahiliyyah period, the Arabs, especially from the Bani Amir tribe, forbade wearing clothes when performing tawaf around the Ka'bah, and prohibited certain foods during Hajj, such as eating meat, fatty foods, and so on. Some Christians and Jews also forbade eating good things, similar to the practices of the Arabs during the Jahiliyyah period. Therefore, this verse explicitly commands the Prophet Muhammad to ask them, who forbade all of these things? It is clear that they themselves forbade it, not as a revelation conveyed by Allah to His Messenger.

Clothing and adornments have indeed been provided by Allah for them, and Allah does not forbid good, delicious foods, such as lawful sustenance from Allah. Wearing beautiful clothes, dressing up and adorning oneself, and eating delicious foods that Allah has made lawful are human pleasures and desires. Islam permits them, as long as they do not contradict Allah's law.

Abandoning such pleasures and desires is not considered worship or a means of drawing closer to Allah. The desire to wear good clothes and the desire to eat good and lawful food will encourage people to think dynamically and creatively, improving agriculture, creating irrigation systems, and advancing in the field of industry, such as yarn factories, textile factories, and improving the care of animals, such as sheep, silkworms, livestock, and so on.

Furthermore, in this verse, Allah commands the Messenger to convey to his ummah that adorning oneself with beautiful and elegant clothes, as well as eating good and delicious foods, is permissible for believers to enjoy in their lives in this world, and it is also permissible for non-believers. However, on the Day of Judgment, such pleasures are exclusively for the believers. The disbelievers have no right to enjoy them. All humans have the right to a happy life, enjoying all kinds of good and lawful gifts from Allah during their life in this world.

The Messenger of Allah said:

"A believer who eats good food and is grateful is of the same rank as a fasting person who patiently endures hunger." (Narrated by Ahmad, at-Tirmidhi, an-Nasa'i and al-Hakim from Abu Hurairah).

Allah says:

"And whoever turns away from My remembrance - indeed, he will have a depressed life, and We will gather him on the Day of Resurrection blind." (Taha/20: 124)

At the end of this verse, it is explained that Allah has clarified His verses for those who know. Among them, this verse explains the etiquette of clothing and food, which some people do not know, and even consider it a minor matter. In fact, eating and drinking in moderation is the foundation of health. If the body is not strong and healthy, all work will not be accomplished, whether to seek a livelihood or to worship Allah. Likewise, dressing up and wearing good clothes is a sign of happiness and prosperity and is also closely related to health. People who dress up and wear good clothes are honorable and praiseworthy, as long as they dress up and wear good clothes with good intentions, not to boast.

The Messenger of Allah said:

I came to the Messenger of Allah, wearing bad clothes, and the Messenger of Allah asked, "Do you have wealth?" I replied, "Yes." The Messenger of Allah asked again, "What kind of wealth?" I replied, "Allah has bestowed upon me camels, goats, horses, and slaves." The Messenger of Allah said, "If Allah has bestowed wealth upon you, then let the traces of Allah's blessings and His honor be seen upon you." (Narrated by Abu Daud from Abu al-Ahwash from his father).
text.33:
In this verse, Allah commands the Messenger of Allah to convey to the polytheists and disbelievers what Allah has forbidden. What Allah has forbidden is not like what the polytheists have forbidden without any evidence or revelation to prohibit it, but they fabricate it, such as forbidding wearing clothes during tawaf or forbidding eating meat during the hajj. Indeed, what Allah has forbidden in this verse must be avoided completely, because its danger is very great, both to those who do it and to all of humanity. Allah's prohibitions are as follows:

1.  Committing indecent acts, whether outwardly or secretly, including indecent acts such as adultery, homosexuality, disgusting and dirty acts that cause great sins.

2.  Acts that cause sin, such as drinking khamar, gambling, and others.

3.  Acts that transgress limits, act unjustly towards fellow humans, and violate personal or collective rights.

4.  Associating partners with Allah. This is the most heinous act and a major sin that will not receive forgiveness from Allah. Associating something with Allah, such as idols, gravestones, trees, and others, shows a foolish act without using reason and thought.

5.  Inventing laws that Allah has not commanded or distorting laws, declaring what is halal as haram and what is haram as halal. Such actions are strictly forbidden by Allah, because they can lead to a wrong understanding of religion or can turn a true religious belief into a false religion.

From such actions arise divisions in religion. They claim to know about religious matters, but in reality they have no knowledge, and instead they fool others. Whether intentional or unintentional, such fabricated work is forbidden by Allah, especially to determine a law in Islam. To determine a law, there must be clear evidence, either from the Al-Qur'an or the *sunnah* that is *mu'tabarah*, it cannot be guessed or based on mere suspicion. Guessing or suspicion is not knowledge. Knowledge fosters certainty. Allah says:

"And do not say about what your tongues assert of falsehood, "This is lawful and this is unlawful," to invent falsehood about Allah." (an-Nahl/16: 116)
text.34:
This verse explains a historical reality, that every people or nation has a provision called its *ajal* (appointed term), which is a specific time limit for advancement or decline, prosperity or destruction. Allah determines this according to His *sunnah* (established way) and His will. The provision of *ajal* refers to the appointed time for the descent of punishment upon a people or nation that has been disobedient, unwilling to accept the truth, acting arbitrarily according to their desires, and not hesitating to commit vile and reprehensible acts.

Therefore, the provision for the descent of punishment is of two kinds: first, that the people are destroyed and annihilated until they disappear from the face of the earth. Like the calamities that Allah sent upon the people of Noah, 'Ad, Thamud, Pharaoh, Lot, and others. These people have disappeared from the face of the earth because of their disobedience and denial of the teachings brought by each of the messengers. They had been warned repeatedly, but they did not believe, and even became more defiant and arrogant. Then their *ajal* arrived with destruction and annihilation until they were wiped out.

Allah says:

"And such is the seizure of your Lord when He seizes the cities while they are committing wrong. Indeed, His seizure is painful and severe." (Hud/11: 102)

Punishment that results in destruction like this is only specifically applicable to past nations and will not happen again to the *ummah* (community) of Prophet Muhammad, because the coming of Prophet Muhammad is a mercy for all the inhabitants of this universe. Allah says:

"And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a mercy to the worlds." (al-Anbiya'/21: 107)

The second provision: that the people become humiliated, poor, ignorant, colonized, and so on. Allah sends down punishment not to destroy them, but their greatness and glory are lost, and they fall into a humiliated people, with no value or glory left.

Historical reality has shown many times that a people who were initially prosperous and respected, eventually become humiliated and impoverished, because they squander their wealth on immoral acts. They act arbitrarily, committing injustice against fellow human beings, spending the people's wealth in an improper way, whether through corruption, fraud, and so on. The disease of *shirk* (associating partners with Allah) spreads rampantly, in addition to worshipping Allah, they also worship His creation. Then the *ajal* of that people or nation comes, and they become a weak and humiliated people in the eyes of mankind. The coming of punishment cannot be postponed even for a moment, nor can it be brought forward. No one knows when that punishment will come, whether at night or during the day, sometimes it comes suddenly, when the people are complacent, forgetting themselves, enjoying themselves, then the punishment of Allah descends unexpectedly. If they knew when the *ajal* would come, of course they would ask for it to be postponed, and they would immediately correct their mistakes, and abandon evil deeds and sins and so on.

The sudden arrival of *ajal* gives the understanding that Allah is All-Powerful and cannot be hindered or matched by human power. Finally, the people regret it, but that regret is useless.
text.35: This verse reminds mankind about the coming of the messengers who were sent to every people at a predetermined time. They were human beings, not other creatures, who were given the task of conveying the verses of Allah that explain what is halal and what is haram, what is right and what is wrong, so that mankind would not go astray and deviate from the right path. The verses of Allah were recited so that it would be clear what is commanded to be done and practiced, and what is forbidden to be avoided and shunned. Then, those who are obedient and compliant to the teachings brought by the messengers, are pious to Allah and constantly improve themselves and perform righteous deeds, those people will be happy and joyful. There will be no fear or sadness for them, whether when living in this world or in the Hereafter. Living happily and joyfully is a very precious gift from Allah, more valuable than abundant wealth and riches.
text.36: This verse explains that there are people who do not want to believe in the verses of Allah. Not only do they not believe, but they challenge every Messenger who comes bringing the verses of Allah with arrogance and pride. They feel it is inappropriate to be led by a Messenger whom they consider to be lacking in nobility (social status), lacking in wealth, and younger than them. This is like the leaders of the Quraysh tribe who challenged the Prophet Muhammad with arrogance and pride, refusing to believe in him and refusing to follow him. Because they considered themselves more entitled to be leaders, such as Abu Jahal, Abu Sufyan, and others. They considered themselves more noble than the Prophet Muhammad. Likewise, the Jewish leaders refused to believe in the prophethood of the Prophet Muhammad because he was not from the Children of Israel (Bani Israil), but from the Arab people. The kings and leaders of the Majusi were also like that, initially refusing to accept the prophethood of the Prophet Muhammad, because they looked down upon the Arabs. But in the end, many of them entered Islam, while many others rebelled, denied, and completely rejected the prophethood of the Prophet (saw). These are the ones who will be inhabitants of Hell forever.
text.37:
This verse explains that fabricating lies against Allah and His verses is the most unjust act. Inventing falsehoods and lies against Allah means obligating what Allah has not obligated, distorting laws, declaring the permissible as forbidden, the forbidden as permissible, the truth as falsehood, the falsehood as truth, or daring to say that Allah has offspring or partners. Denying Allah's verses means rejecting, mocking, and ridiculing them. Their actions are considered the most unjust, and they will enjoy worldly pleasures for a while, but in the Hereafter, they will be punished with a severe torment. That is Allah's decree written in His Holy Book. Allah says:

"We let them enjoy themselves for a little while, then We will drive them to a harsh punishment." (Luqman/31: 24)

When the unjust person enjoys worldly pleasures, it suddenly ends because their appointed time has arrived when the angel of death comes to take their soul. Then regret arises when the angels ask them, "Where are those whom you used to invoke besides Allah, whom you worshipped, sought help from, and refused to worship and seek help from Allah? Call upon them to help you escape the danger of the Hellfire you are facing." But alas, with great regret, they answer, "Those whom we worshipped and sought help from have vanished from us; we do not know where they have gone or where they are." Our hope of receiving help from them is cut off. Then they openly confess that they have become disbelievers and are astray because they worshipped and sought help from idols and leaders whom they associated with Allah.

This described event is a warning and threat from Allah to the disbelievers, urging them to be careful not to follow the propaganda and deception of someone that will lead to disbelief and deviation.
text.38:
On the Day of Judgment, Allah commands the disbelievers to enter Hell, together with the communities that preceded them, from among the jinn and mankind. They had already entered Hell first, because of their disbelief and disobedience. The devils from among the jinn and mankind always tempted their people and tempted humans to stray from the right path. They were already in Hell. Allah says: "Dwell you with them in the Fire, and make them your helpers, as you lived in the world making them places to seek help." From this verse, it is clear that the disbelievers do not all enter Hell simultaneously, but in waves. The first wave enters, then the next wave follows, and then mutual cursing occurs among the disbelievers in Hell. Every time a community enters Hell, and they see how terrible the torment of Hell is, they curse the companions who misled them, whom they followed with complete loyalty during their life in the world, and who are now equally plunged into Hell. Allah says:

"Then on the Day of Resurrection you will deny one another and curse one another..." (al-'Ankabut/29: 25)

The polytheists curse the leaders who misled them, and so do the Jews and Christians curse the leaders who misled them. Thus, every community or group curses their companions who were leaders who misled them during their life in the world. Finally, when everyone has entered Hell and they have gathered in it, and they have all felt the painful torment of Hell, then the followers say to Allah, about the leaders who misled them, "Our Lord, these leaders misled us, and we blindly followed their commands. O Allah, give them double the punishment in this Hell, heavier than our punishment, because they were astray and misled us." Allah answers the request of the followers, saying, "For each of them is double, but you do not know." They in Hell suffer equally, there is no difference between the followers and the misleading leaders, because they were astray and misled others. Likewise, those who were led are punished because they were astray and blindly accepted falsehood. Each group does not know the type of punishment inflicted on the other.
text.39:
This verse explains how their leaders disclaim and absolve themselves of responsibility from the demands of their followers. The leaders, who have entered Hell first, say: "If it is indeed as you accuse, that we misled you and that our punishment should be doubled from the punishment you receive, then now you taste the punishment of Hell because of your own foolishness, wanting to be misled from the right path. We did not force you to follow us, but you yourselves chose the path of error, committing sins and disobeying Allah." Thus, in the end, they blame each other, and it is of no use anymore, because they will all be together in the blazing fire of Hell.

Allah says:

And never will it benefit you that Day when you have wronged, that you will be sharing in the punishment. (az-Zukhruf/43: 39)
text.40:
What is meant by denying the verses of Allah in this verse is denying matters related to monotheism (tauhid), such as those related to the existence of Allah and His Oneness, those related to prophethood, the Day of Judgment, the Day of Resurrection, and others. They deny, refuse to accept, and reject these verses with arrogance and pride, so the gates of heaven will not be opened for them.
